decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The key strategy revolves around establishing a solid board presence with efficient threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Leyline Binding. By efficiently managing resources and playing proactively, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, while also utilizing powerful support cards to control the board and protect your creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, while using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Static Prison to deal with threats and maintain board presence. Overall, the strategy revolves around quick and decisive plays to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly power out aggressive creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It combines powerful artifact synergies with disruptive spells like Force of Will and aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Memory Guardian. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient game plan, utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to generate value and maintain pressure. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help to enable explosive starts and maintain consistency throughout the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the necessary pieces to generate a large amount of mana quickly, then using that mana to cast powerful spells like Wish','','');">Burning Wish, Echo of Eons, and Reforge the Soul to dig for combo pieces and win the game in a single turn. The inclusion of cards like Defense Grid and Jeska's Will help protect the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Bauble with cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton, the deck can generate fast mana and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Sink into Stupor and Force of Will to control the board and protect its key pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around rapid artifact deployment and aggression to secure victory.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources by utilizing land destruction, discard spells, and creature removal to control the board. It also aims to generate advantage through the use of Urza's Saga and Eumidian Hatchery, creating a resource advantage over time. The deck also includes threats like Barrowgoyf and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis to close out the game. Overall, the focus is on resource denial and value generation to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Murktide Regent. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for equipment like Meteor Sword and Cryptic Coat to increase board presence and provide additional utility. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler allows for card advantage and tempo play. The deck also runs a land destruction package with Wasteland and utilizes Stifle to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a slower, more controlling style of play.

The deck focuses on assembling the resources needed to produce a high storm count and cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony spell. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Duress. Wishclaw Talisman can act as both a tutor and a win condition. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to chain together spells and generate a powerful storm turn to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This UWx control deck focuses on powerful card advantage and disruptive spells to control the game. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and powerful threats, the deck aims to outgrind opponents by leveraging its versatility and strong card selection. It utilizes efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares alongside cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Orcish Bowmasters to generate advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the colors needed for its spells while also including utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Undercity Sewers.

The deck is focused on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It uses various cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo. Thassa's Oracle is the win condition in this deck, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and digging for combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Street Wraith for cycling and card draw, as well as Daze for additional disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around using Doomsday to stack the deck in your favor and win the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly drop powerful artifact creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Memory Guardian, the deck aims to generate value from artifacts while applying pressure on the opponent. Force of Will provides a layer of protection against spells that could disrupt the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck seeks to establish a fast and threatening board presence while controlling the game with artifact synergies and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. It seeks to control the game tempo and maintain board presence by using disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Wasteland, while utilizing quick threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opposing threats. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. The deck aims to stay one step ahead of the opponent and win through relentless aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell accompanied by some form of big finisher like Omniscience or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It utilizes various tutors, cantrips, and counterspells to manipulate the game state in their favor while also having ways to protect their combo pieces. The deck aims to cheat out powerful threats ahead of schedule to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn. It combines elements of control, ramp, and combo to create a unique and powerful strategy in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control through the use of various counter spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle, while also utilizing removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares. The deck also heavily relies on Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Batterskull and Meteor Sword to gain a board advantage. Additionally, cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, Murktide Regent, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional support and card advantage. The mana base is composed of various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana fixing.

The main concept of this Aggro Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like City of Traitors, Chrome Mox, and Simian Spirit Guide, allowing for early plays such as Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to take advantage of powerful red cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption to control the board while deploying threats like Pyrogoyf and Magus of the Moon to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and flexibility in obtaining key artifacts to further cement the deck's aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to rapidly apply pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost creatures and burn spells while disrupting their mana base. The deck aims to control the board while swiftly dealing damage and closing out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent allows for consistent aggression, while cards like Force of Will and Daze provide protection and disruption. Additionally, cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help manipulate the deck for optimal draws, ensuring efficient gameplay.
